event_full-description: "The demons have been, from the beginning of time, images ingrown force impious the natural and the supernatural. Everything that leads us to err, to divert the road, I surrender to our most primitive and desalmado.Hoy I question me. and if we ourselves reflected in a mirror ?, and if the soul and its recondite confines keep all that impurity and others ascribe to fantastic beings to us ?. man is his own demon. the New Demons are those that we form, are not fantasy, not allegory, are not the external influences that haphazardly flexes virtue and seduces with evil. demons us. we are our own worst enemy. "Montana Gallery Barcelona invites for the first time in Barcelona to Mexican artist Smithe (Mexico, 1987) to present their work in the exhibition space. Opening Thursday July 14 20h. Exhibition July 8 to September 2, 2016 + info

event_title1: MACBA is viu / Antoni Hervàs and Modern Court
event_full-description: #MACBAesviu Summer Special: PUNK. His reastres in contemporary art. Thursday July 14, 19 h Antonio Hervas and Modern Court represent "Negociudad" Entrance: 5 €. Free with general admission of the Museum Pass card and Friends of the MACBA. Limited capacity. The entrance gives access to exhibitions until 21 h. Antonio Hervas and Modern Court go beyond the traditional conception of the artist or a band, respectively. In his "Hercules in the moon" project , Antoni Hervàs already had the BOUT group!, Which were part Xabel Ferreiro and Ignacio Estrada-Nora, who currently make up Modern Court with Jordi GG It is not surprising, therefore, that the collaboration backwards arises naturally, and that in the case of "Negociudad" Modern Court are those who seek to Antonio Hervas. The artist has transformed "Negociudad" in a pop-up drop - down illustrating the disk with the same title published by Editorial Newfoundland. "Negociudad" is a concept album in the tradition of the rock opera, and narrates the mass exodus of the rural classes to the big city, in a work that is both a revisitation of the germ of Marxist thought and a dystopian description current urban hypertrophy. The challenge in this case is the MACBA will become the same pop the disc. More information: http://bit.ly/MEV-punk http://antonihervas.com http://cortemoderno.com + info

Opening: July 14, 20h "Metabolism is a process in which the body synthesizes everything it receives. Complex entities are refined to present its essential to be assimilated unit. For years I have tried to mimic this method of condensing everything that I created. These sculptures and paintings reflect a step in the quest to perfect this process letting me take new ground " + info

event_title1: Walking Gallery Barcelona - Fiestas del Raval
event_full-description: Saturday during the walking tour, we will have the special presence of Sergio Trumpet, not the hype lose! See you:) ! "Just as art is evolving, art galleries should be too. And that is why it appears Walking Gall ery, an art room without walls, without local without building where the artists exhibit their works in contexts completely alternative, turning the fact of exhibiting art in a social and innovative action. " What is Walking Gallery? Walking Gallery is a cultural movement that identifies with the artist 's gesture to transport his work in the streets of the city, both in groups and individually. How Walking Gallery develops? Walking Gallery is nothing but a group ride with different artists who have to walk their works. Are you an artist and want to participate? Simply send an email to info @ walkinggallery and we explain. Whence comes WG? WG was born in Barcelona (Spain) in April 2009 when the artist Jose Puig (Barcelona) took the first walk with his slung over his shoulder with the intention of developing Walking Gallery as reciprocation within the art world picture. Moving Art! Www.walkinggallery.com + info

We are inaugurating new art show in La Federica: They get the fantastic illustrations of Javier Rubín Grassa. See you Thursday July 14 from 21h! PROLOGUE OF EXPOSURE: What if things started by the end? Who said we needed a medal to want to run or a place you come to decide to fly? We strive to name the end, to give enough to catch our steps today strong enough to reach power. But, what if we would feel already so strong without the goal marked? Some time ago, they asked me why I do so much emphasis on moles of my artwork. I have always found small traces of bread crumbs to follow. It did not matter where they were, but that would lead me to where I should be. And that's how I present this new chapter of my work. A brief look at now, not wait until the end to enjoy the partridges. To think that every gesture and every moment has some amazing that deserves to be lived as unique. Javier Rubin Grassa + info

event_title1: Javier Jaen & The New York Times Magazine
event_full-description: Javier Jaén collaborates with The New York Times since 2010. Illustrates weekly to the "First Word" in the NYT Magazine section. Resulting in images articles on language and our time. Essays on words like "selfie", "refugee", "radical" or "austerity" model today and build opinion. His work has recently been awarded a Trophy Grand Laus. It is presented in the Casa Camper Club until July 25. Born in Barcelona (1983) Javier Jaen formed between the Catalan capital, New York and Budapest. As a graphic artist, uses different languages ​​to build symbolic messages. Usually develops his professional activity in the fields of editorial illustration, design book covers, cultural communication and creating own work. He has worked among others for The New Yorker, The Washington Post, Time, Harvard Universtiy, National Geographic, El País, Penguin Random House and UNESCO. + Info

Sessions Guarrantinas 5th Edition, subject Fluids Fluids are substances that are generated and flow through our body during sex. They are present, with their different qualities, properties, quantities. The exchange of these varies according to sexual orientation. Saliva, sweat, vaginal fluid, semen, urine, blood and tears ... This year the goal is deeply immersed in the fluid. Who also filled information submitted works may inquire about the benefits of each, and question yourself whether it is related to any of the practices carried out with certain less common fluids. Friday July 29, 2016 / 8:30 p.m. Admission: Anticipada_10 € / Taquilla_15 € (Includes glass of champagne and gourmet tapas) + info
